reviewText: I choose this movie has I personally enjoy Connie Francis movies and her singing. fantastic singer and actress. God family movie for all.
Title: When The Boys Meet The Girls

reviewText: This movie was made when I was in my teens. I am now a 60 plus nana. I enjoyed it as much now as I did then. who said you can't go back. well, this one took me back. loved it
summary: When the Boys Met the Girls
Title: When The Boys Meet The Girls

reviewText: When The Boys Meet The Girls is a camp riot ! Connie Francis plays Ginger Gray who runs a dude ranch in Reno. I love it that Connie's films are now all available, and that 3 have Boys in the title. MGM knew the audience they were selling to in the 1960's. Connie  sings When The Boys Meet The Girls, Mail Call, Embraceable You, I Got Rhythm, and But Not For Me.  In this her last film Connie Francis keeps her fans happy. I am one !
Title: When The Boys Meet The Girls

reviewText: Harve Presnell had one of the most beautiful and pure singing voices. Paired with Connie Francis, you can't go wrong. A really cute movie with some fun music. Very entertaining!
Title: When The Boys Meet The Girls

reviewText: This is the third remake of "Girl Crazy" by "cheapy" producer Sam Katzman to cash in on Connie Francis. Harve Presnell, fresh off his "Unsinkable Molly Brown" appears completely lost in the proceedings. I don't know how long this movie took to make, but the diminutive Francis with the huge voice, shows marked weight fluctuations in many scenes. The studio that she helped support through her enormous record sells, put her on illegal diet pills (shades of Judy Garland).The plot is nothing much to speak of. It never was and is given little support here about a rich Eastern womanizer who gets into trouble and is sent off to a small Nevada college. The great score remains intact and several new songs are added but does not enhance this musical in the slightest. I must admit the title theme sung by Connie Francis was more effective than some of the Gerswhin tunes warbled by other cast members. And Connie Francis is not a "duet" person, her voice is too commanding...she's better when she's singing solo.All the performances are mediocre and much of this due to the terrible script and dialogue. But we do have the great Louis Armstrong on hand. He is the most enjoyable thing in the movie. Connie gives it her best (she does overact at times), but nothing can save this movie. Stick to the definitive Garland/Rooney version of "Girl Crazy".I am glad to see all four movies made by Ms. Francis available for the first time on DVD. This should delight her fans, and appall serious movie buffs.Another cheap marketing ploy to utilize the then reigning female songstress in the world. Connie they should have let you do all the singing in the movie as you did in the first three, and cut out Sam The Sham and Herman's Hermits. The score is just not suited for them.Terry Robertson (author)"Fill My Eyes""Heart of a Hobo""Broken Windows, Reflections of a Fool"
Title: When The Boys Meet The Girls

reviewText: Well this movie leaves a lot to be desired in a good movie musical script.  However, if you are a great fan of Connie's you enjoy seeing her in anything.  The story is weak, the sets cheap, the acting bad, but through it all there is Connie singing her heart out. There are some great Gershwin songs included.  The best scene in the entire movie is the opening title track with Connie singing "When The Boys Meet the Girls".  A classic rock song by long time writer Howie Greenfield (Where the Boys Are) sung as only Connie can.  It's fun in a throwback 60's, comedy way.  Connie was not an actress as she admits. MGM did their best to ring every dollar out of her, and they did.  She alone kept the studio afloat in the early 60's with the MGM record label and the millions of records she sold here and over seas.  I suggest you like connie or campy B rated 60's movies to buy this Connie movie.  Oh, shoot, get it anyway, its fun.
summary: I love Connie what can I say
Title: When The Boys Meet The Girls
